text: We see an Italian village at the height of the plague.  F processions, decrepit houses with their windows boarded u the stench of death all around.
Through the filth a KNIGHT walks his horse.  He is weary not so dingy as his surrounding; a stranger in these part He comes to an inn, where a boy takes his horse round bac He enters the inn.

The inn is dark and almost empty.  A couple of patrons dr silently at tables.  Behind the bar stands a slovenly BAR dark-haired and lazy.  She scratches at her shoulder, on we see a birthmark.  The knight approaches the bar, throw money down.
A tankard of ale, wench.
The barmaid pours him a cup of ale.  He drinks deep, stan moment.
(continuing) Some plague we're having, huh?

The barmaid leads the knight, by candlelight, upstairs to room.  The door opens inward.  The knight stands in the d places a hand on the barmaid's hip.  She pauses a moment, breaks free of his grasp, starts down the hall.  He laugh bit, resignedly, and closes the door. A VAMPIRE stands behind it.  Not two feet from the knight grinning at him.  His eyes are skull-hollow and dancing i head, his bloody smile full with teeth.  His skin is gray peeling.  The knight turns slowly and sees him.
Oh, my god...

The vampire licks his lips. He is on the knight in a second, pushing him backwards in the middle of the small room.  The knight struggles but i match for the vampire, who buries his face in the knight' neck.  The knight screams.

It suddenly flies open, the lock shattered. The vampire turns like a frightened animal.  In the doorw stands the barmaid, a SLAYER.  In her hand is a wooden st The vampire drops the knight, who crabs backwards into a The Slayer and the vampire come at each other.  The Slaye spins and kicks; the vampire flies back.  Snarling, he co back at the slayer.  They struggle; he slips free and is the door. For a moment, the Slayer remains still, crouched on the f The knight watches her.  She seems to be making a decisio perhaps even knows what is going to happen. She runs at the window.

The vampire comes running out the front door.  Before he few feet from the front of the inn, the Slayer SMASHES th the upstairs window and lands on him.  They both hit the and she plants the stake right in his heart. After a moment, we hear a voice:
The lord giveth, and the lord taketh  away.  Ashes, ashes...
She looks up.
(continuing) ... All fall down

There are ten or more vampires walking slowly toward her the otherwise deserted street.  At the front, maybe ten f away, is AMILYN. Amilyn is a grinning jackal, a servant to the Vampire-Kin His garb is a rotted approximation of a courtier's livery ambles toward the Slayer, giggling, as she stands. Behind her is LOTHOS, the Vampire-King.  His skin is deep and smooth.  He wears a long coat -- his dress is not of era.  He is practically upon her before he speaks.
You must forgive Amilyn.  He tends  to drool before supper.
She turns.  He smiles, almost lovingly.
Lothos...
You people will never learn.
She swings at him but he grabs her arm.  Amilyn laughs  obnoxiously.  Lothos grabs the back of the Slayer's head, her to him in a loving embrace.
(continuing) We can't be stopped.  This is our  world now.
He pulls her head back swiftly, snapping her spine as her hits the back of her legs.  Lightning flashes.
Lightning flashes outside the window.  It is torrenting r An old MAN speaks to a hysterical GIRL of sixteen or so. are both obviously noble of birth.
I can't!
You know you must.  There is only  one.  Now you are that one.  It is  time.
Why?  Why me?
She has died.  You are the next to  be called.  Why do you think you  were sent to me?  Trained as you  were?  You bear the mark.
He pulls aside her blouse to reveal a birthmark on her sh identical to the barmaid's.
(continuing) The mark of the Coven.
I don't understand.

Ever since Adam and Eve first left  the garden, he followed: the serpent.   Satan.  He sends his legion in the  shape of men, to feed on us, to  breed his Hell on our earth.  They  are a plague upon us.
The man unravels a satchel of cloth.  From it he pulls an elaborately carved wooden stake.

(continuing) But as long as there have been  vampire, there has been the Coven;  the line of Slayers.  Ones with the  strength and the skill to kill them,  to find them where they gather and  stop the swell of their numbers.   One dies, the next is called.
I'm just a girl.
You are much more.
He hands her the stake.  She feels the fit.
(continuing) One dies, the next is called...
As she grips the stake more tightly, an awareness and sen power sees to fill her.  She lifts the stake over her hea
The hand is lifted high, but it is not the girl's.  It ho not a stake, but a pom-pom.

Opening CREDITS OVER: A football game in progress.  The stands are pretty full, crowd enthusiastic.  The hemery football stadium is just a real stadium, not just makeshift stands on grass. On  the sidelines are the Hemery cheerleaders, led by BUF She is blonde (in nature as in name), pretty, and very  gracefully athletic.  She obviously enjoys what she is do and she's good at it. With her on the squad are JENNIFER and NICOLE, two of her friends.  Beside them the COACH, yelling at the players. scoreboard reads HEMERY VS. SETON. On the field are JEFFREY, wide receiver (and Buffy's boyf ANDY, quarterback, and GRUELLER, the huge left tackle. Buffy and the crowd wince as Andy is sacked for a nine-ya loss.
Come on, do the play!  The one  where...  the one from the book!   Where you make it go forward!
The players huddle.
All right, guys, come on!
He hits Grueller's helmet.

(continuing) Grueller!  Fill that hole!  They  were all over me!  Okay.  Let's run  twenty-two.  Grueller, close the  pocket, watch out for thirty-five.   Thompson, run the post, right, wide  out.  Jeffrey, go up the middle and  run around like a chicken.
They clap and break.  As they line up, Jeffrey looks over Buffy.  She smiles at him.  He winks, very suave.
Jeffrey!  Jeffrey!  He's our man!   If he can't do it  We don't want it!

On the hike, Andy drops back and looks for a receiver.  J runs in circles like an idiot (and not unlike a chicken), his arms until Andy sails him the ball and he breaks for touchdown. The crowd goes wild -- particularly Buffy, who does an  impressive standing backflip.  Nicole looks at her, impre Buffy smiles at her, giddy.
(looking around) Is that good?  Was that a good thing?

The mall is typically busy.  Buffy, Nicole, Jennifer and  KIMBERLY can bee seen making their way through it.  They all dressed very similarly:  bright colors, a lot of whit pink.  Not trashy, but mainstream and uninspired.  Esprit All of them carry shopping bags; they've done a good days
The girls pass by stores, vaguely window shopping.
Mr. Howard is so heinous.  He's  always giving me a hard time.  I  get a C-plus on the test and he  tells me, 'You have no sense of  history.'  I have no sense of  history?  He wears a brown tie.
You got a C-plus?  I can't believe  I cheated off you.
Excuse me for not knowing about El  Salvador.  Like I'm ever going to  Spain anyway.  Ooh!
A dress on a rack outside a store has caught her eye.  Sh takes it and holds it in front of her.
(continuing) Mmmm.  Wouldn't I look just edible  and nutritious in this?
Kimberly and Jennifer catch up to them.
Guys, what's the sitch?  I'm bored.
(modeling the dress for  Kimberly)) What do you think?
Please.  It's so '91.
Oh.
Buffy puts it back.
What are we doing?
Why don't we see a movie?
Well, where?
Omniplex?
Nee sitch.  No way.
No THX.
They don't even have Dolby.
Beverly Center.
Please.  They show previews for  foreign movies.
AMC?
Bogus corn!
Totally stale.  And the ushers are  like, the acne patrol.  We're  thinking Pavilion.  Sitch?
Sounds toasty.  We're going Pavilion.
Excellent.
What's playing there?
A stranger, walking the other way, bumps into Buffy, does stop.  A man of about fifty, he is dressed shabbily, in a wrinkled black suit and a black shirt.  He somewhat resem a priest.
(continuing) Excuse much!  Not rude or anything.
(calling back) Nice ensemble!
What a homeless.

The girls continue walking.  The man stops, turns to star after them.  His look is intense, slightly worried, his f somewhat haggard.  Intelligence shines through his eyes. holds himself stiffly, arms close to him, almost as if he expected something to strike at him. This is MERRICK.  He pulls a picture out of his coat pock looks at it.  Looks at them.
The film is in progress.  This has no effect on the girls however, as they continue to talk ceaselessly.  They all diet sodas.
(to Buffy) So, is Jeffrey really spending the  night at your house?
That's the plan.
Good enough!
Your parents are always going away  for the weekend.  You're so lucky.
(maybe not) Yeah, I guess.
My mom doesn't go anywhere.  She  even does the shopping network.   I'm gonna die a virgin.
What did Jeffrey's dad say?
'Just remember you're in training,  son'
Oh, God.
He is so bald.

Seated a few rows behind the girls are PIKE and BENNY.  T are fairly punked out, (and not currently attending high  school).  Pike is long and lean, has short hair spiked an taste for long coats and black.  Benny is somewhat stocki opts for a shaved head and suspenders.  Doc Martins for b Benny is clearly the more belligerent of the two -- when speaks, it's with surprising wit and reserve.  Sometimes.
Will you guys shut up, please?
It could happen.
Pike and Benny throw popcorn at her.
Booo!
Suck!
Wrong answer!  No prize.
God!  Take a chill lozenge.
Like we don't have rights too?
Ignore them.
I can't believe these people.  We  paid money to see this.
No, we didn't.
Oh, yeah.  But I still want to know  what happens.
Everyone get horribly killed except  the blonde girl in the nightie, who  finally kills the monster with a  machete but it's not really dead.
The boys stare at her.
Oh, my God.  Is that true?
Probably.  What movie is this?
Fat and yellow, behind the clouds.  We hear a long HOWL.
Jeffrey pulls into the parking lot in his BMW convertible Grueller, howling, sits in the back behind Jeffrey and An They park and hop out, head toward the entrance.
Look at that moon!  It's huge!   Come on, guys, we gotta do something  tonight.  Party.
You know, if you would spend more  time at home sleeping, you would  spend less time on the field,  sucking.
You were a bone out there today.   Anyway, I'm booked.  Gonna spend  some quality time with the little  woman.
(coughing it into their  hands) Pussy-whipped.  Pussy-whipped.
You guys are pathetic.
Later for you, then.  I'm blowing.   Andy, you coming?
No, I'll hitch a ride with Jeffrey.
Okay.  Later.
Headbutt!
Andy and Grueller bring their foreheads together with  painstaking slowness, grimacing, and barely tap heads.
(continuing) Later.

Grueller walks off, head through a park. At the same time, Pike and Benny emerge from the theater. They pass Andy and Jeffrey and the two pairs circle each almost growling, eyes locked, before pike and Benny turn walk off, not quite in the direction Grueller took.  Buff Kimberly, Jennifer and Nicole come out right after.  Buff heads straight for Jeffrey and they kiss massively.
Nice game.
Jeffrey, I don't mean to sound sexist  or anything, but can I borrow her?
Andy!
No way.  You'd get her dirty. (off her look) He would, honey.  He's an animal.

Grueller walks through the trees, enters an enclosed clea of grass.  He hears something, stops.  Maybe his name, ma just the BUSHES RUSTLING.  He looks about him, hesitantly Starts forward, stops again.
Yo!  Who is that?  Don't mess with  me man, I'll rip your head off.
Nothing.
(continuing) Come on, come out here.  Let's see  what you got.
RUSTLING.  No one.
(continuing) Forget this.

He turns on his heel, ready to drop all show and bolt.  W BESSEL is right behind him. Wally is a ninth grader, small, nerdy, and recently undea In marked contrast to the older vampire in the prologue, is freshly undead.  He still has fat on his face; in fact looks almost normal from afar.  But his inhuman eyes and uncommon pallor mark him as a vampire.  And the way he sp is unearthly.  Hollow, almost detached; repeating phrases sometimes almost as though he had never heard them before He smiles at Grueller.
(continuing) Bessel!  What are you doing here?
Hi, Grueller.
What are you grinning at?  You think  I was scared?
Could be.
You think so?
Could be.
Grueller grabs Wally by his shirt collar and readily hois his small body up, Wally's feet dangling two feet off the ground.
Listen, you little worm.  I could  beat your head to a pulp for you,  just like I did last year, you got  that?  You got that?
(repeating) Got that.
Good.
He lets Wally go.  Wally remains two feet in the air.   Grueller's eyes go wide.
(continuing) What the...

Wally smiles even more broadly, quietly hissing.  He has fangs, made somehow more grotesque by the fact that he al has braces. Wally's hands vise onto Grueller's head, lightning quick. Grueller screams.
Crossing a street, turning and listening.
Speeding by, everyone packed into it.  Andy howls back at Grueller, mistaking his intent.  He settles back.  The gi are looking at him.
It's um... you had to be there.
In the front seat next to Jeffrey, Buffy winces slightly.
You okay?
I... yeah, I'm okay.  I'm fine.

We see another full moon, this one on the TV screen.  "Dr is on, Lugosi's original. The lights are off in the living room as Jeffrey enters f the kitchen, sits down on the couch holding a bag of munc Buffy is still in the kitchen, making corn.  Jeffrey flic the remote, changes channels.
The movie is replaced by the local news, in mid-broadcast NEWSCASTER sits at his deck, a super of a teenage girl be him.
-- The fourth such disappearance in  less than two months.  The sheriff  was not available for comment, but  a police spokesman issued a  statement, saying that the situation  is not out of hand...
Buffy's FATHER walks purposefully into the kitchen holdin suitcase that he plops by the front door.  He crosses out as Buffy's MOM crosses in, also with luggage.
We're gonna be late.  I knew it.
(to Buffy, but not looking  at her) Now, we'll be back on Sunday,  number's on the fridge, don't drive  the Jaguar and tell Consuela my  underwear does not go in the  dishwasher.
She's already out again by the end of this, as dad comes in.
Have fun be good stay away from the  Jag.
I know.
And he's out the back, mom entering on his heels.
Well, that's everything.  Kiss noise.
She actually makes a kiss noise at her daughter.
'Bye.
Buffy's mom heads out the door as Buffy heads into the li room.
(calling out) Bye-bye, Bobby!
Bye! (to Buffy) They think my name's Bobby?
Well... it's possible they think my  name's Bobby.
Real 'quality-timers,' Hugh.
Something like that.
Hey, it works for me.  If they want  to leave you alone in the house,  all helpless and vulnerable...
Buffy sits, squints disapprovingly at the screen.  She ha bag of microwave lite popcorn and is spraying diet butter substitute on it.
What show is this?
It's the news, Buffy.
Oh.  Who's in it? (off his look) I know what it is.  It's what's on  instead of the movie.
I just want to see the basketball  scores.  It's important.
(over a handful of popcorn) Mmmnkay.
Jeffrey leans in toward her.
Of course, there are... other  considerations...

He starts kissing her about the face and neck.  She leans submissively back on the couch as he works his way on top her.  He gives her a long kiss on the mouth, then works o to her ear.  As he is burrowing about in there, Buffy sne another handful of popcorn into her mouth. She leans back, by accident, on the remote.
"Dracula" reappears.

Not, by any stretch, an upscale joint.  Dark, cramped, an scummy.  A young Chinese Whore sits on a bed, wearing lit enough that we can see the telltale birthmark on her shou A repulsive British SAILOR is dressing, his business fini Looking disgusted, he throws his payment on the bed.  For reason, the bed is littered with popcorn.
You never touched my heart.

He leaves.  Alone, the Girl hears a NOISE in the dark cor a wet RUSTLING.  Slowly she gets up to see.  Approaches.. It is a pool of blood.  She stares at it, terrified.  A h reaches out of it. She runs out into the hall, but it leads nowhere but a de end.  Standing there, waiting for her, is Lothos.  He smi at her and we see she is now Buffy.
Soon.
Buffy is thrashing in bed.  Jeffrey is holding her by the shoulders and shaking her.
Buffy!  Hey, what's the sitch?!?   Wake up!
She wakes, grasping, her eyes melting into focus on Jeffr face.
Oh, wow.  Oh, wow.  Oh, wow.
You were having a nightmare.
He settles back down, his arms around her, and almost ins begins to fall asleep again.
(continuing) What'd you dream about?
Nothing.
Come on, what was it?
Nothing.  It was just a dream.

Dark, cavernous -- walls hewn from rock, lit torches clam to them.  Cold stone floor and in the foreground, a dark of blood.  A HUM, possibly a chant, fills the air. A figure steps up to the pool, his back to the CAMERA, an kneels before it.  He holds his hand over the surface of blood.  As he speaks, his voice an urgent hiss, we TRACK him, see that it is Amilyn.
You have brought us here, and we  thrive.  We thrive.  You will awake  in a new world.  Just as I promised,  untold splendor, rubies dripping  from our lips.  Just as we said.
A hand shoots out of the pool and grabs Amilyn's.  Amilyn over and fervently kisses it.
(continuing) Soon...
Buffy sits with Nicole, Jennifer, Kimberly and CASSANDRA. Cassandra is not quite in the same league as the other gi for one thing, she studies.  She's not as glamorous, nor vacuous.
The environment.
They consider this a moment.
The homelesses?
Oh, please.
Are there any good sicknesses that  aren't too depressing?
Guys.  The environment.  I'm telling  you, it's totally key.  The earth  is in terrible shape, we could al  die, and besides, Sting's doing it.
I thought he was doing Indians.
Jeffrey and Andy arrive, sit.  Jeffrey straddles Buffy fr behind, wrapping his arms around her.  She snuggles in hi grasp.
Hey there.
Hi.
(shyly) Hi, Jeffrey.
Whatchya guys doing?
The winter dance.  We need to come  up with a theme.
The senior dance?  How about...  'Our Friend, the Beer?'
'Putting Out for Fun and Profit'...  possible thought...
Try new Clue-flakes.
It has to be, like a socially  conscious theme.
(reading from a memo) 'One that reflects the students'  growing awareness of and involvement  in the world around them.'
Downer.
I still say the environment.  That's  my suggestion.
It is a pretty crucial subject.
See, Cassandra likes it.  Cassandra's  my friend.
I like it.  Can I be your friend?
Stay away from my thang. (to Buffy) Sorry, honey.  'Thing.'
Environment.  That's cool with me.
Okay.
So, what are the most immediate  threats to the world environment  right now?

Cassandra has paper and pen, is poised to make a list of  suggestions.  The other all look at each other uncomforta Cassandra obviously knows the answer, but regards her fri silently, waiting to see what the come up with.
Well, um... litter?
Litter, yeah!
Everyone but Cassandra is impressed by this.
(to Cassandra) Write that down.
Okay, what else?
Forest fires?
Communism?
Bugs.
(helpfully) Okay, guys, how about the ozone  layer?
Oh, yeah!
Right!
We gotta get rid of that!  That's  right.
GARY MURRAY, a well meaning but pompous little administra come up to the kids.  He's kind of like Charlie Brown:  y always say his whole name.

I don't suppose you kids heard the  first bell, did you?  The first  bell was saying, 'Start going to  class, it's time to go to class.'   In about thirty seconds the second  bell is going to be saying, 'Already  be in class.'
We're having a very important  discussion here.
Why do I have trouble believing  you?
Something from your childhood, maybe?
Button it, Kramer.  Classes are  starting.  Be there or beware.
Gary Murray walks off.
Man has a complex.
He's got a...  What do you call it?   A Napoleonic Code.
It's 'cause he's so tiny.
Yes, but what he lacks in height he  makes up in shortness.
They get up and start heading to class.
Let's meet tonight, okay?
Where?
Cafe Blase.
Cool.  We can figure decorations  and stuff.
Cassandra, you gotta come, too.
Can't.  History report.  The Normans  and the Saxons.
Bogutude.  Blow it off.
I really can't.  Besides, it's pretty  interesting.
(not harshly) You're weird and I'm afraid of you.   Seriously, Cassandra, there's a lot  cooler things you could be doing  than your homework.
Like what?
Like my homework.
Buffy smiles, trots off.

We see SHOTS of the deserted city at night.  It's a small upscale town.  Suburban streets, businesses, and a  few m depressed areas, boarded up houses.  No one is out.  TREE RUSTLE, shadows flicker, but the curling mist is the only visible presence.

A classic faux-Fifties L.A. diner.  Pictures of Frankie a Annette, bright lights, those same tired Fifties standard playing on the JUKEBOX.  Buffy, Kimberly, Jennifer and Ni are sitting at the end of the counter, at the corner.
I don't see why we have to invite  everyone.
Kimberly, it's the senior dance.
If we don't invite all the seniors  we can't use the school funds, you  know that.
Can't they make exceptions?  Maryanne  Heinel?  She's such a scud.  Can't  we have a Maryanne clause?
Well, look who's here.
Pike and Benny have entered the diner, quite drunk.  As t pass the jukebox, Benny gives it a kick and the music sto A few people look up, annoyed, as they approach the count
Hey!
The Fifties are over.
(earnestly) We have to learn to let go.
Don't give me any trouble, okay?
No trouble.  We just want to eat.
They sit next to Buffy and begin pooling their money on t counter.  It comes to about $2.50, heavy with pennies.
(continuing) Come on, come on, fork up the scub.
That's it, man.  That's the whole  story.
We're looking at a dog, possible  coffee...
He digs and produces a quarter from his pocket.
(continuing) It's coffee.
Amazing!
(to the other girls) Smell of booze much.
Nice much.
(to the waitress) Can we have a hot dog, please, medium  rare, and a cup of joe?
You guys are thrashed.
(to Buffy) What are you talking to them for?
(to Buffy) What did you say?
Yeah, we're drunk.  We're the Drunks.   What's your name?
Buffy.
Figures.
Do people ever call you 'Buffy the  Buffalo?'  I'm just wondering.
Buffy gives him a look.
(continuing) The don't.  You kind of wish they  would, though.
Wit-tay.
I'm sorry.  I'm Pike.  This is Benny.
Pike isn't a name.  It's a fish.
Hey, wait a minute...
You're the guys from the movie!
(good naturedly) We hate you guys!
The girls all make sad noises, real sarcastic.
(continuing) You guys were way rude.  It was  shocking.
You just snuck in anyway.
So you have to ruin the movie for  us?  You know, other people have  feelings, too.
I am so sure.
The waitress brings the hot do.  Benny takes it out of th and holds it over his crotch, phallus-like.
Hey, Buffy, you hungry?  I got  something for you...
The other girls look down and shriek.  Buffy looks at Ben looks at him in the eye.

It closes silently around the knife at her place. Buffy is still looking at Benny, she seems to be hypnotiz him, and maybe even herself.  The NOISE in the diner seem FADE AWAY for a moment.  Buffy shifts slightly, almost a and the spell is broken.  The SOUND RETURNS, Buffy looks letting go of the knife exactly where it was. Benny looks down.  His hot dog has been sliced neatly dow about an inch.  He is shocked.
(continuing) Hey!  She wasted my dog!
(smiling) Bummer metaphor.
Buffy looks off, a little surprised herself.
Pike and Benny have left the diner and are walking down t street.  Pike produces a bottle of Mezcal from his coat p and takes a swig, hand it to Benny.  They continue to pas back and forth.
Rich bitches.  They're a plague.   They've gotta be stopped.
You didn't like them.
They're all the same!  They're so  stuck up, they're just... they're  not even human.  I hate them.
Would you sleep with them?
Yes.  Definitely.  Definitely.   Please, God.
Well, there it is, isn't it?  You  don't even like them, and you'd  sleep with them.  What's that all  about?
I got a news flash, man, another  shot of this and I'll have sex with  you.
Oh, yeah, and then you'll never  call me.
They continue walking.  A shadowy figure appears behind t following.
The girls have all finished their sundaes.
Come one, that was so weird.
(uncomfortable) What, it's not weird.  I just cut  the stupid hot dog in half.
I can't believe they still ate it.
(to Buffy) Where'd you learn how to do that?
I didn't learn... I just... it's  not a big deal.
Buffy, I'm gonna tell Jeffrey you  were playing with another man's  Hebrew National.
(annoyed) Get a boob job.
It's like when we took gymnastics  in eighth grade.
Buffy makes a face.  She doesn't want to hear this story. HOLD on her as Nicole tells it.
What happened?
Buffy was on the uneven parallels --  she was really good; coach said she  could have been in the Olympics --  but she was doing a routine,  spinning, and the beam broke.
You're kidding.
Snapped.  Buffy was, you know, on  the upswing, and I swear to God she  went across the room.  Perm over  heels.
Oh, my God!  Ouch!  No wonder you  quit.
Well, that's the thing.  She landed  on her feet.  Didn't even sprain a  toe.  And I go up to her and she  turns and looks at me and she's  like this --
She makes a hyper-intense face.  The others laugh.
(continuing) -- like she's gonna kill me.
I was just scared is all.
No.  It was mondo bizarro.
Buffy, the ape-woman.
Seriously, Buffy.  That look was  way twisted.  What were you thinking  about?

Perhaps in answer, we see the same shadowy figure moving Pike and Benny as they continue to walk home.  They're re bombed now.  They are somewhere in the hills now, and the come to the edge of a steep incline overlooking the valle waist-high concrete wall is built into the side of the ea They stand below a thick, green tree.
I'll have it running in a week.   It's be beauty.  It just needs new  shocks, you know, break pads, an  engine, and some wheels.  It'll be  totally cherry.
Pike finishes the bottle, eats the worm, and chucks the B over the side.  There is a moment before they hear it SHA
When you get your car together,  man, let's bail.
You think?  Split?
Utterly.  Let's bail this town.   It's getting... I don't know.  Let's  go somewhere where there aren't any  rich bitches.
Our own world, where we could live  and grow beans.  Hundreds of beans.
Benny wavers, catches hold of Pike.
I think I'm gonna ralf.
He leans over the side of the wall, hangs his head down.
Don't worry, Benny.  I'm here for  you.
Pike falls over backwards.
(continuing) I'm here for you, Ralf.
